review_blob: The beer has a deep brown color. I got subtle hints of a fruity coffee aroma. The taste has a bit of coffee mixed with chocolate and fruits. Very drinkable beer

Picked a bottle up at the brewery. The beer has an aroma of a chocolate spice. First sip is kind of an impact of flavors with a chocolate taste but finishes with a spicy kick. This beer definitely is a heavy/rich beer. Not my cup of tea but still a good beer.
beer_name: New Belgium Lips of Faith - Cocoa Mole

review_blob: This beer in my opinion was an easy drinker. At first pour it has a red hue to it with a sweet smell. I have had it on tap at the brewhouse and felt that it was a bit sweeter than the bottle. Overall though I thought was an excellent Alt style ale.

picked up bottle at local liquor storeTasted bottle. Poured a reddish brown. It had the aroma of caramel, toffee, and toasted malts. I got hints of caramel when tasting it. It was sweeter than I had it imagined it to be but overall I thought it was a good American take on a dunkel.

I was pretty excited to get this beer at first. First pour it has a nice reddish hue to it and the aroma was a sweeter smell. The taste however really threw me for a loop, at first it was really bitter and tasted like a leather but after letting it sit for a few minutes it still had that leather flavor but not as prominent. Overall I thought it was a decent beer, there definitely could have been something more to the flavor.
